definition[0]: to tell someone something that is not true in order to stop them from complaining
example[0]: She fobbed him off with a promise to pay him the money next week.
definition[1]: to give someone something that is not very good instead of the thing they really want
example[1]: They tried to fob me off with a cheap camera.
definition[2]: to give someone something that is not as good as the thing they really want
example[2]: East Europeans are highly sensitive about being fobbed off with out-of-date stock.
definition[3]: to giving someone an explanation, excuse etc that is not true in order to stop them complaining or asking questions
example[3]: I’m tired of being fobbed off with excuses and promises.
